SENT.plain: Diabetes is a major global problem
During the past decade, the genetic basis of various monogenic forms of the disease, and their underlying molecular mechanisms, have been elucidated
Many genes that increase type 2 diabetes (T2DM) risk have also been identified, but how they do so remains enigmatic

Nevertheless, defective insulin secretion emerges as the main culprit in both monogenic and polygenic diabetes, with environmental and lifestyle factors, via obesity, accounting for the current dramatic increase in T2DM
There also have been significant advances in therapy, particularly for some monogenic disorders
